intro: Trixis angustifolia, commonly known as narrowleaf trixis, is a perennial flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, commonly known as the buckwheat family. The plant features slender, upright stems and small, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are typically greenish-white and appear in clusters, adding a subtle aesthetic to its natural habitat.
